name: Stichting Crime Stoppers International
goal:
Crime Stoppers International (CSI) is an independent non-profit organization since 1976, officially registered in the Netherlands as a foundation and its mission is “to mobilize the world to provide information on crime anonymously”;
- with its affiliated and accredited national and local Crime Stoppers programs in 28 countries CSI forms a global network and provide a global platform for communities around the world to report on crime anonymously and the provided information shall be passed on to the law enforcement and other investigators in such a way that the tipster remains anonymous at all times;
- CSI maintains strategic partnerships with key global organizations such as the International Criminal Police Organization (INTERPOL) since 2010 and the United Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC) since 2016;
- being a global organization, which exists to help law enforcement to stop, solve and prevent crime, CSI intends to mobilize the world to provide information on the following crime areas: financial crimes, illicit trade, cybercrimes, fugitives, human trafficking and environmental crimes;
- the unique tripartite model of law enforcement, media and the community is the basis of CSI’ success in mobilizing communities to take greater responsibility for their safety and security and this tried and tested model is respected and trusted by law enforcement agencies and communities around world (every 14 minutes, a crime is solved somewhere in the world thanks to CSI);
euInitiatives: Taking part in EIC Horizon - 2020 Prize “BLOCKCHAINS FOR SOCIAL GOOD”
